title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.42 | 16-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chapsharun Miritam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadi Gauravhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devi Saraswati Vyasa Tato Jaya
Mudeerayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 42nd verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Tatha Ahritam Pashuvat Pasha Baddham
Avangmukham Karma Jugup Sitenah
Niriksha Krishna Apakritam Gurusutam
Vamasvabhava Kripayananamachan
The meaning of this verse is
Sri Suta Goswami said
This is Suta Goswami speaking
Draupadi then saw Ashwathama who was bound with ropes like an animal
and silent
for having enacted the most inglorious murder
due to her female nature and due to her being naturally good and well behaved
she showed him due respects as a brahmana
So this verse is describing when ashwatthama was brought bound up by Krishna
sorry bound up by Arjuna both Krishna and Arjuna had
ah...
gone in Arjuna's chariot, Krishna as the charioteer chasing Ashwatthama who was trying to
run away after having enacted the most inglorious murder. Ashwatthama had killed the five sleeping
sons of Draupadi and it was condemned even by his master Ashwatthama's master Duryodhana.
Because Duryodhana was fighting the battle on religious principles.
So what are the Pandavas? So in such a battle to kill somebody who is just sleeping,
that is already explained earlier. It is not proper to kill
somebody who's sleeping like that even though the person is
on the enemy camp. It doesn't matter. Now here Ashwatthama was bound with ropes like an animal
but what is Ashwatthama's position? Ashwatthama was bound up because he did not
behave like a Brahmana he did not behave like a Brahmana even though he is the son of a Brahmana
son of Dronacharya son of the Acharya teacher military teacher of Arjuna and he deserves to
be respected as such but he behaved most degrading manner he degraded himself so therefore Arjuna
bound him up but when he was brought in front of Draupadi she showed him due respects as a
Brahmana see the difference in the
way Draupadi looks at Ashwatthama and the way Ashwatthama is actually looked at by
Arjuna after his having committed the most inglorious murder so Srila Prabhupada explains
in the purport Ashwatthama was condemned by the Lord himself Krishna told Arjuna he doesn't
deserve to be respected as such but he deserves to be respected as such but he deserves to be
respected as such but he deserves to be respected as such but he deserves to be respected as such
to be excused because he has committed the most inglorious murder is degraded himself and even
Ashwatthama was treated even by Arjuna just like a culprit not like the son of a Brahmana or teacher
but then when the same Ashwatthama was brought in front of Srimati Draupadi although she was very
much aggrieved for the murder of her sons the murderer was present before her and in spite of
all this she could not withdraw the due respect generally offered to a Brahmana or the son of a
Brahmana this is very culture very glorious culture exalted behavior
of the members especially the members of the upper three classes because they trained up the
Brahmanas Kshatriyas and Vaishyas are trained up in proper behavior proper etiquette in the right
in in in the necessary skill to be acquired for them to do their profession to earn their livelihood by
their profession to earn their livelihood by their profession to earn their livelihood by
properly getting trained and acting responsibly in the society so that is not there in the present
time so much it's not there whatever little culture remains we still see in this great
country Bharatvarsha we still see that the remnants of the culture the remnants of the culture
but actually the training that should really happen is not happening
so Shrila Prabhupada says in the purport that Draupadi knew that Ashwatthama was actually a
murderer and she herself was directly affected all her five sons were killed most ingloriously byleth
by Ashwatthama in spite of that she did not withdraw the due respect that is offered to such a
brahmana or a son of a brahmana according to the very culture according to the way she is trained
up in the culture now it is also explained this is due to her mild nature as a woman
their mild nature women as a class are no better than boys and therefore they have no
discriminatory power like that of a man so according to vedic civilization
because of the mild nature of a woman she must be protected she must be protected
so if they are
protected they can be led to goodness very easily and if they are not protected they
can be polluted very easily also that is a position of a woman
just like a child if you mold the character of a child from the very beginning
then such a child can grow up to be a great personality either a man or a woman
if you train a woman from the very beginning how to become chaste and faithful to the husband
they can become a very good mother a very good asset in the family because the whole family life
is especially meant for begetting good children such
so unless the woman is chaste and faithful to the husband and is
trained up it will not be possible to beget good children so this point of training whether
man or woman both have to be trained janmana jayate shudra samskara vijam ucyate this is
also very important man or woman by birth nobody is generally qualified i mean generally
i mean somebody who's born under the force of karma they are getting a body a material
body because of their past karma so they have to be trained up they have to be trained up
it doesn't matter even though they are born in a brahmin family doesn't matter but they
have to be trained up untrained means they remain shudra they remain ignorant they remain
ignorant they remain purified they remain into the transcendental that is the number
ignorant by birth everybody is born into ignorance that is explained in the Bhagavad Gita
so everyone is born into ignorance but they can be trained up they can be trained up
so that is a whole system in the Vedic culture to train up whether man or woman everybody has to be
trained up so Srila Prabhupada says there is sufficient information in the Vedic literature
how a man should be trained up how a boy should be trained up how a girl should be trained up
so that in future they may become happy and what is that ultimate aim of life how to become
connected with Krishna as spirit soul it doesn't matter whether you are a man or a woman
matter whether somebody is born as the son of a Shudra or a daughter of a Vaishya
it doesn't matter they can be trained up everyone every human being at least can
be trained up to understand the ultimate aim of life is to become connected with
Krishna that's called yoga that that specific science of yoga is taught by
Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita in the fourth chapter Krishna says
imam vivasvate yogam proktavanaham avyayam
Krishna is telling
I taught the science of yoga to vivasva and now I am going to teach you he is
telling Arjuna that same science of yoga so that science of yoga is that actually
each one of us every spirit soul every living being is connected with Krishna
and that connection is called yoga and
therefore
ultimately one has to learn about who am I who is Krishna what is my relationship
this is what Chaitanya Mahaprabhu teaches as the fundamentals of the Vedic knowledge
there are so many departments and so many details but we should learn this fundamental
thing
you should not miss out this
ultimate aim to connect with Krishna so therefore Srila Prabhupada says that in
this Kali Yuga to get into the details of all these different divisions or
branches of knowledge is not practically possible there is no time there is no
inclination there is no proper gurukul system to teach all those details
according to the candidate according to the circumstances no simply Chaitanyama
would taught chant Hare Krishna
chant Hare Krishna and then by chanting Hare Krishna all the knowledge will be revealed
within the heart and the heart becomes cleansed by chanting
Hare Krishna all that knowledge will be rehealed and everything will become first-class when
one becomes a devotee by chanting Hare Krishna I will stop here. Thank you very much.
broken
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
